stocks.note: *Numbers as of market close on Feb 27th at 4:00 PM ET
stocks.news:
Stellantis Posts Historic Loss:

Jeep maker Stellantis reported its first annual loss in company history, posting a full-year 2025 net loss of ‚Ç¨22.3 billion ($26.3 billion), compared to a profit of ‚Ç¨5.5 billion in 2024. The loss was driven by EV write-downs across its brands including Jeep, Dodge, Fiat, Chrysler, and Peugeot.

Nvidia Beats But Falls:

Nvidia (NVDA -5.46%) beat Q4 earnings expectations ‚Äî reporting adjusted EPS of $1.62 vs. estimates of $1.53 and revenue of $68.1 billion vs. estimates of $65.9 billion ‚Äî but the stock fell anyway. Markets had priced in perfection, and investors used the beat as an opportunity to sell. Nvidia has now fallen more than 5% over two consecutive sessions.

economy.note: *Numbers as of market close on Feb 27th at 4:00 PM ET
economy.commentary:
Low-Hire, Low-Fire Job Market:

Weekly jobless claims came in at 212K, better than the expected 216K ‚Äî a positive sign for labor market resilience. But economists caution this isn't necessarily good news. The market is stuck in "low-hire, low-fire" territory: employers aren't adding jobs, but they're not cutting them either. Businesses appear to be in a holding pattern as they wait for more economic clarity.

GDP Miss + Sticky Inflation:

Fourth-quarter U.S. GDP grew just 1.4%, badly missing Wall Street estimates. At the same time, inflation firmed at 3% ‚Äî well above the Fed's 2% target. The combination of slowing growth and sticky inflation raises the risk of stagflation, keeping the Fed in a difficult position heading into spring.

Note: The 10-Year Treasury nominal yield fell below 4% to ~3.97% on Friday ‚Äî its lowest in three months ‚Äî as investors fled to safety amid stock market declines.

crypto.note: *Numbers as of market close on Feb 27th at 4:00 PM ET
crypto.commentary:
Crypto CEO Arrested Over $328M 'Ponzi Scheme':

Goliath Ventures CEO Christopher Alexander Delgado has been arrested and charged with wire fraud and money laundering in connection with an alleged $328 million crypto Ponzi scheme. If convicted, Delgado faces a maximum sentence of 30 years in prison. The case is a stark reminder of the ongoing fraud risk in unregulated corners of the crypto market.

real_estate.homebuilder: J.P. Morgan Global Research projects U.S. house prices to stall at 0% in 2026 as increased supply from new construction balances out muted demand ‚Äî a significant shift from the price growth seen in recent years.
real_estate.commentary:
The Bay Area continues to face extremely tight supply, particularly for single-family homes, while the condominium segment is seeing a significant slowdown with increased days on market.

Latest Real Estate News in the Bay Area:

üè° Divergent Markets in Silicon Valley: In Santa Clara County, the median price for single-family homes saw a 3.89% year-over-year decline to $1,730,051, while inventory remains 12% lower than last year. In contrast, Alameda County single-family median prices rose 2.86% to $1,150,000.

üè° Condo Market Slowdown: Across the region, condominiums are spending significantly more time on the market than single-family homes. In Santa Clara County, condos are averaging 55 days on the market ‚Äî a 57% increase year-over-year ‚Äî compared to just 14 days for single-family homes.

üè° Seller's Market Strength: Both Alameda and Santa Clara counties remain firmly in seller's market territory with less than one month of supply for single-family homes (0.9 to 1.1 months of inventory).

Latest General News in the Bay Area:

üì∞ Public Safety Incident in Fremont: Police recently clarified a shooting incident where a sergeant accidentally discharged his weapon and injured a burglary suspect after being bitten by a police dog during the arrest.

üì∞ Black History Month Celebration: The Fremont Age Well Center is hosting the "Ijo Ope" Black History Month celebration today, February 27.

üì∞ Milpitas Area Service Updates: Local libraries continue to host community events, including "Bouncing Babies Storytime" at the Fremont Library today, while regional high school sports move into playoff seasons.
